title: How to Write Email Campaigns with ChatGPT
description: Create professional email campaigns that bring back past customers and generate new business.
requirements: A free email marketing tool (Mailchimp, MailerLite)

steps.title: Choose a free email marketing tool
steps.description: You need something better than regular email for campaigns.
substeps: Mailchimp: Free up to 500 contacts — mailchimp.com
MailerLite: Free up to 1,000 contacts — mailerlite.com
Both let you send professional emails and track opens/clicks
Create an account before continuing
steps.tip: MailerLite has a more generous free tier. Mailchimp is more popular.

steps.title: Import your customer emails
steps.description: Get your contacts into the system.
substeps: Export customer emails from your CRM, invoicing tool, or phone
Create a simple spreadsheet with name and email columns
Import into Mailchimp/MailerLite
Clean up any bounced or invalid emails
steps.tip: Only email people who've done business with you. Don't buy email lists.

steps.title: Use ChatGPT to write the email
substeps: Go to chat.openai.com

Try this prompt: 'Write a short email to past customers of my [trade] business. Topic: [seasonal tune-up offer / checking in / new service announcement]. Keep it friendly and include a clear call-to-action.'
Review and personalize the output

steps.title: Craft a compelling subject line
steps.description: The subject line determines if anyone opens your email.
substeps: Ask ChatGPT: 'Give me 5 subject line options for this email'
Good subject lines are: Short, specific, create curiosity
Examples: 'Spring is coming — is your AC ready?' or 'A quick note from [Your Name]'
Avoid spam triggers like ALL CAPS, 'FREE!!!', excessive punctuation

steps.title: Send a test and then launch
substeps: Send a test email to yourself
Check: Does it look good on mobile? Any typos? Links work?
Schedule for Tuesday-Thursday, 10am-2pm (best open rates)
Hit send!

steps.title: Track results
steps.description: See what worked so you can improve.
substeps: Check open rate (20-30% is good for local businesses)
Check click rate (2-5% is typical)
Track replies and bookings from the campaign
Use learnings for your next email

successMessage: You just sent your first email campaign! Past customers are your easiest sales.
proTips: Send at least one email per month to stay top-of-mind
Seasonal emails perform great: spring cleanup, fall prep, holiday scheduling
Include before/after photos when possible — visual proof beats text
